hints.content:
Every bill has a different value.

Dollar name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
One dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/526e9b19f2c39d0d908b6c531d510186f6e93e97.png) | $\$1$
Five dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/5069901d0226c2c5f1c3e73b2b5d7e48ee1e1eee.png) | $\$5$
Ten dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/35b0286a92e1825d39af39b5e362e5d9674eb00d.png) | $\$10$
Twenty dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/66f0febd8ba41a0e3413f72b2f1fc2d54a3819de.png) | $\$20$

Let's label the value of each set of bills and find the total.

###$3$ twenty dollar bills, $1$ ten dollar bill, and $3$ one dollar bills

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}}   + \underbrace{\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ ten dollar bill}}} +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{60}}_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}} 
 + \underbrace{\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ ten dollar bill}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{3}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$73
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$73$, so it is **not** equal to $\$68$.

###$6$ five dollar bills and $8$ one dollar bills

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\purpleD{5} + \$\purpleD{5} + \$\purpleD{5} + \$\purpleD{5} + \$\purpleD{5} + \$\purpleD{5}}_{\purpleD{6}{\text{ five dollar bills}}} + \underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}+ \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{8}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\purpleD{30}}_{\purpleD{6}{\text{ five dollar bills}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{8}}_{\blueE{8}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$38
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$38$, so it is **not** equal to $\$68$.

###$2$ twenty dollar bills, $2$ ten dollar bills, $1$ five dollar bill and $3$ one dollar bills

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}}   + \underbrace{\$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}} + \underbrace{\$\purpleD{5}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ five dollar bill}}} +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{40}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}} 
 + \underbrace{\$\goldE{20}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}}   + \underbrace{\$\purpleD{5}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ five dollar bill}}}+\underbrace{\$\blueE{3}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$68
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$68$, so it **is** equal to Dan's amount of money.

Dan could have this set of bills:

$2$ twenty dollar bills, $2$ ten dollar bills, $1$ five dollar bill and $3$ one dollar bills

question.content:
Dan has $\$68$.

**Which set of bills could Dan have?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: $6$ five dollar bills and $8$ one dollar bills
$2$ twenty dollar bills, $2$ ten dollar bills, $1$ five dollar bill and $3$ one dollar bills
$3$ twenty dollar bills, $1$ ten dollar bill, and $3$ one dollar bills
